value.name: Gary Brown: Recalling cutting grass, toiling in kitchen
value.description: I was mowing the lawn the other day, instead of listening to a baseball game, and I wondered.             What was it about this job that I once cherished?             When I was a child I couldn't wait to mow the lawn.

value.name: Monday After: Law enforcement actions a longtime focus of protests and media debate
value.description: "DILEMMA OF DUTY," another headline said, identifying the issue in the 1995 package of stories about law enforcement use of force.

value.name: The end may be near for virtual public meetings in Detroit: What it could mean
value.description: Virtual public meetings weren't perfect in Detroit, but they did teach us some lessons as officials consider a return to in-person meetings.

value.name: An arsonist who torched an historic 5.4-million-dollar Christchurch villa has been jailed
value.description: Today, the Christchurch District Court heard Brown has longstanding issues with alcohol dependency. Judge Quentin Hix sentenced Brown to four years, eight months in prison -- saying it wasn't realistic to make a reparation order.

value.name: Family of Ashley Dighton found beheaded in Ashford 14 years ago make fresh appeal to find killer
value.description: Fourteen years after his death stunned the county, the siblings of a man found beheaded have made a fresh appeal to trace his killer.
